Package org.interstellarocean.terraforming.reflection

Support for model transformers using reflection libraries.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ReflectionModelTransformer<SOURCE,DESTINATION>
    Implementations are used to perform actual transforming.
    ReflectionModelTransformer.To<DESTINATION>
    Transformer's transforming step fluent interface.
    ReflectionModelTransformerBuilder<SOURCE,DESTINATION>
    Builder allowing creation and configuration of a ReflectionModelTransformer instance.
    ReflectionModelTransformerBuilder.Build<SOURCE,DESTINATION>
    Builder allowing creation and configuration of a ReflectionModelTransformer instance.
    ReflectionModelTransformerBuilder.ExcludeFields<SOURCE,DESTINATION>
    Builder allowing creation and configuration of a ReflectionModelTransformer instance.
    ReflectionModelTransformerBuilder.To<SOURCE,DESTINATION>
    Builder allowing creation and configuration of a ReflectionModelTransformer instance.
    ReflectionModelTransformerFactory
    Entry point for ModelTransformer to reflection model transformers.
    ReflectionModelTransformerProvider
    Provides builder allowing creation and configuration of ReflectionModelTransformer instances in a library-independent way.

Package org.interstellarocean.terraforming.reflection Description

Support for model transformers using reflection libraries. Model transforming using reflection shall be considered a supplementary technology, where the usual use of data structures' accessors and mutators (or fields access) is most robust and is the preferred way to implement model transforming. Implementors are discouraged from using reflection transforming library's advanced configurations and techniques as these are frequently not robust, not portable between libraries, and may lead to bugs that are hard to track. All fields that cannot be transformed by simple reflection shall be just excluded from reflection transforming and transformed by the base model transformer instead. And don't forget to write tests for your model transformers regardless it uses reflection or not.

References

  • Java Bean Mapping is wrong, let's fix it! @javatronic.fr
  • Dozer vs Orika vs Manual @sokolenko.me
  • Java Object to Object Mapper @javacodegeeks

Description

Set of interfaces allowing clean separation of ModelTransformers code from external reflection transforming libraries.

ModelTransformer implementors should follow the guidelines:

  1. ModelTransformer should use ReflectionModelTransformerFactory's factory and strategy patterns to obtain and use requested library provider's ReflectionModelTransformer builder. The factory's builder method invocation should be parameterized with requested types of transformer to be build.

    ReflectionModelTransformerProvider interface provides a builder allowing creation and configuration of ReflectionModelTransformer instances in a library-independent way. The provider implementation should isolate the library allowing easy change of used library in ModelTransformer implementations. ReflectionModelTransformer instances built by the provider implementation must be thread-safe.

  2. ModelTransformer should use obtained ReflectionModelTransformerBuilder to actually create and configure ReflectionModelTransformer instance. Instances returned by the builder are thread-safe.
  3. ModelTransformer should use built ReflectionModelTransformer instance to perform actual reflection transforming.

Example

 public class FooToDtoModelTransformer implements ToDtoModelTransformer<FooDomain, FooDto> {

        // This is the only contact with actual reflection transforming library. Easy to change if needed!
        private static final Class<?> FOO_LIBRARY = org.bar.Foo.class;

        private final ReflectionModelTransformerFactory reflectionModelTransformerFactory;

        private ReflectionModelTransformer<FooDomain, FooDto> toDtoReflectionModelTransformer;

        @Inject // @Autowired, etc.
        public FooToDtoModelTransformer(ReflectionModelTransformerFactory reflectionModelTransformerFactory) {
                this.reflectionModelTransformerFactory = reflectionModelTransformerFactory;
        }

        @PostConstruct
        void buildReflectionModelTransformer() {
                ReflectionModelTransformerBuilder<FooDomain, FooDto> builder = reflectionModelTransformerFactory.getBuilderFor(FOO_LIBRARY);
                toDtoReflectionModelTransformer = builder
                                .from(FooDomain.class)
                                .to(FooDto.class)
                                .excludeFields(emptyList())
                                .build();
        }

        @Override
        public FooDto toDto(FooDomain domain) {
                return toDtoReflectionModelTransformer.from(domain).to(new FooDto());
        }

 }
